title: How to Play Snuggle Bug

steps.headline: Get together with a fairly large group of friends or at least 5 people.
steps.description: Get a mixture of male and female players, or if you want it can be single sexed.

steps.headline: Get a bowl or anything similar to that.
steps.description: For example, a hat, a pillowcase, a bucket etc.

steps.headline: Go to a suitable location if your parents give you permission you could use your house.
steps.description: Wherever you go, be sure that there are places you can hide (not somewhere like behind a sofa, but a different room).

steps.headline: Get everyone who is playing to one place and get them to sit or stand wherever they want, as long as everyone is in one room.
Get strips of paper, so that each person playing has one.
On all the strips of paper, except for 1, write down "You're not the Snuggle Bug" or, if you want to save time, just leave it blank.
steps.description: On one of the pieces of paper you left out, write down "You're the Snuggle Bug".

steps.headline: Put all the strips of paper in your bowl or whatever you have and put all the strips of paper in.
Give everyone a strip of paper from the "bowl".
steps.description: They can read it, but they can't let anyone know what's written on their piece of paper or if there is nothing on it.

steps.headline: Ask some people to volunteer to search for the Snuggle Bug.
steps.description: It shouldn't be too many, about 2 people searching for every 5 people playing- so if there were 10 people playing, 4 people out of those 10 would be searching. Also, if you are the Snuggle Bug, don't mess up the game and volunteer to search for the Snuggle Bug (i.e. yourself), it's just really annoying.

steps.headline: Turn off the lights and everyone should spread out, searching for the Snuggle Bug, who should have gone and hidden.
Snuggle if you find the Snuggle Bug!
steps.description: Or if they want they can do anything else.

text: Get together with a fairly large group of friends or at least 5 people. Get a mixture of male and female players, or if you want it can be single sexed. Get a bowl or anything similar to that. For example, a hat, a pillowcase, a bucket etc. Go to a suitable location if your parents give you permission you could use your house. Wherever you go, be sure that there are places you can hide (not somewhere like behind a sofa, but a different room). Get everyone who is playing to one place and get them to sit or stand wherever they want, as long as everyone is in one room.  Get strips of paper, so that each person playing has one.  On all the strips of paper, except for 1, write down "You're not the Snuggle Bug" or, if you want to save time, just leave it blank. On one of the pieces of paper you left out, write down "You're the Snuggle Bug". Put all the strips of paper in your bowl or whatever you have and put all the strips of paper in.  Give everyone a strip of paper from the "bowl". They can read it, but they can't let anyone know what's written on their piece of paper or if there is nothing on it. Ask some people to volunteer to search for the Snuggle Bug. It shouldn't be too many, about 2 people searching for every 5 people playing- so if there were 10 people playing, 4 people out of those 10 would be searching. Also, if you are the Snuggle Bug, don't mess up the game and volunteer to search for the Snuggle Bug (i.e. yourself), it's just really annoying. Turn off the lights and everyone should spread out, searching for the Snuggle Bug, who should have gone and hidden.  Snuggle if you find the Snuggle Bug! Or if they want they can do anything else.
